Authors:
María Inés Messuti, Romina Vidal-Russell, Guillermo Cesar
Amico, Laura E. Lorenzo
Title:
Chaenothecopsis quintralis, a new species of coprophilous
calicioid fungus
Keywords:
Ascomycota, fimicolous species, Mycocaliciaceae, temperate
South America, Tristerix corymbosus
Abstract:
Chaenothecopsis quintralis from south-western Argentina,
is described and illustrated as a new species in the family
Mycocaliciaceae. It has been found in three localities in the Andean
Patagonian temperate forests, growing strictly on dung of an endemic
marsupial Dromiciops gliroides. The new species is distinguished by the
hemispheric and black capitulum of ascoma, the presence of asci with
croziers, 1-celled brown ascospores, and its fimicolous habitat.
Analysis of partial nuclear large subunit rDNA (LSU) sequences showed
that this taxon is within Mycocaliciales.
